results.title: Take me to your Lager
results.brief_description: On landing in outback Australia, an extra-terrestrial stumbles into a local pub to quench his thirst and finds himself getting more than a taste of Australian culture.

results.title: Westbourne Grove
results.brief_description: Combines locational footage with personal reminiscences of growing up in Northcote. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.

results.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.title_for_label: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.description: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.
description_for_label: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.

results.title: The Water catalogue
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: ‘The Water Catalogue’ explores a set of moods or psychological states as reflected in water. The work is a poetic musing, observing water in various physical states. The soundtrack is non-sync industrial/ambient music that augments the visual images. Specific light conditions and atmospheres punctuate this painterly presentation. The speed of images have been manipulated to present a choreographed approach to objects and landscape. We are bodies of water…

results.title: Suspension
results.brief_description: A meditation on the narcissistic nature of the consumption of advertising images, ‘Suspension’ consists of footage of hundreds of models’ head shots taken from magazines that Discenza has repeatedly re-taped and re-scanned into an endlessly mutating image of cut-and-paste beauty. This hypnotic video artwork literally suspends the viewer in a cycle of visual engagement, an energetic interchange from eye to eye, viewer to model, consumer to consumed.

results.title: Costume dresses from the True History of the Kelly Gang
results.brief_description: Crafted from used vintage fabrics and sourced from markets, the individualised dresses in True History of the Kelly Gang are likened to warpaint to scare the enemy by the film’s characters, but they also speak to their inner selves.

constellations_primary.name: Pink, Pose, punk, Pilgrim
constellations_primary.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

results.title_for_label: True History of the Kelly Gang costume dresses
results.headline_credit_for_label:
True HIstory of the Kelly Gang, Australia, 2020

Designed by Alice Babidge
results.description: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. While the characters liken the dresses to a kind of warpaint to scare the enemy, costume designer Alice Babidge explained that “this was about finding a way for men or boys to wear dresses that didn’t feel camp – that felt strong or beautiful”. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.
description_for_label: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. While the characters liken the dresses to a kind of warpaint to scare the enemy, costume designer Alice Babidge explained that “this was about finding a way for men or boys to wear dresses that didn’t feel camp – that felt strong or beautiful”. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.
